page.title: 06EVENTS
page.content:
Early in 1985 a local farmer decided to remove a hedge and trees that were approximately 200 years old without consulting the family whose land it bordered. Because of the age of the trees it became a very controversial matter and moves were made to try and prevent the destruction of the whole of the plants.
The issue was taken up by Lord Melchet who brought up the subject in the House of Lords as it was closely connected to the Concervation Bill. Newspaper reporters took up the story and a report of the affair was televised.
The National Farmers Union became involved and the farmer decided not to remove the roots of the hedge so that it could grow up again.
